guess1: the object is the sacred thread, also known as the poonal or yajnopavita. it is a sacred thread worn by hindu males, especially brahmins, as a sign of their initiation into the vedic religion. the thread is made of three strands of cotton or wool, and is worn over the left shoulder and under the right arm. it is usually changed on the day of the annual shraadh ceremony, which is held in the month of shravana (august-september).
guess2: the object is the new year's cloth, also known as the pongal cloth. it is a new cloth that is worn by people in tamil nadu on the day of pongal, which is the first day of the tamil month of thai (january-february). the cloth is usually made of cotton or silk, and is decorated with traditional tamil designs. it is a symbol of new beginnings and prosperity.
